net.cloud.gfx.elements

Class TextField

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.gfx.elements.AbstractElement
      • net.cloud.gfx.elements.TextField
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Element, Focusable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PasswordField

    public class TextField
extends AbstractElement
    A generic text field. Text input is accepted. Tabs will still move focus. The text is drawn to the screen, showing as much as possible but keeping a limited view of within the field. A cursor shows the current location in the field, and if it is clicked the cursor location will change. Pressing Enter will cause a defined action to be taken.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) class  TextField.Cursor
      A special lightweight class to take care of cursor-related operations, such as tracking its location and drawing it.
      (package private) class  TextField.CursorBlinkTask
      A task to take care of making the cursor blink, rather than always being drawn.
      (package private) class  TextField.DisplayableText
      String wrapper with the added functionality of keeping track of which substring indices are bounding the displayable text.

      • PRIORITY

        public static final int PRIORITY
        Default priority of a TextField. Moderate.

        Delay between blinks of the cursor, in milliseconds
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • hintText

        private java.lang.String hintText
        Text that is already in the field before it takes focus. Then it gets wiped away. May just be null.

      • textBuilder

        private java.lang.StringBuilder textBuilder
        Builder object used just for modifying the text in the field

      • text

        private java.lang.String text
        The string for all of the text in the field. Currently StringBuilder did not offer improvements

      • displayText

        protected TextField.DisplayableText displayText
        Holds the text that should really be drawn. Maybe all of the text doesn't fit.

      • font

        private java.awt.Font font
        The font currently being used by the field

      • hintTextColor

        private java.awt.Color hintTextColor
        Color of the hint text. Usually slightly lighter than the actually text.

      • textColor

        private java.awt.Color textColor
        Color of the input text.

      • glyphVector

        private java.awt.font.GlyphVector glyphVector
        Has all the information for drawing the text. Supposed to be the fastest method.

      • glyphUpdateNeeded

        private volatile boolean glyphUpdateNeeded
        Flag to indicate the glyph vector needs to be updated - rather than nullifying it

      • cursor

        private TextField.Cursor cursor
        A cursor to show where text input will be at.

        private TextField.CursorBlinkTask blinkTask
        A task to make the cursor blink when the field has focus

      • actionMethod

        private java.util.Optional<java.util.function.BiConsumer<TextField,java.lang.String>> actionMethod
        A method called when the text field is acted on. Of course optionally provided.

      • clickX

        private int clickX
        Relative x location of a click, indicating the cursor should be moved. -1 for no outstanding click

      • bgImg

        private java.awt.image.BufferedImage bgImg
        Background - behind the text area itself

      • topBorder

        private java.awt.image.BufferedImage topBorder
        Border framing the top of the field. Aligned to width of field.

      • rightBorder

        private java.awt.image.BufferedImage rightBorder
        Border framing the right of the field. Stretched to fit over top and bottom borders, too

      • bottomBorder

        private java.awt.image.BufferedImage bottomBorder
        Border framing the bottom of the field. Aligned to width of field.

      • leftBorder

        private java.awt.image.BufferedImage leftBorder
        Border framing the left of the field. Stretched to fit over top and bottom borders, too

    • Constructor Detail

      • TextField

        public TextField(int x,
                 int y)
        Creates a default text field with almost everything default. It will be at the given location. The width and height will be suitable for the default font. (100 by 22). There will be no hint text, and the text will be black. The sprites will be the default, as in the first set of text field sprites.
        Parameters:
        x - The x location of the text area itself - not counting the borders
        y - The y location of the text area itself - not counting the borders

      • TextField

        public TextField(int x,
                 int y,
                 int width,
                 int height,
                 java.lang.String hintText)
        Creates a default text field with almost everything default. It will be at the given location. The hint text will be gray, the input text will be black. The sprites will be the default, as in the first set of text field sprites.
        Parameters:
        x - The x location of the text area itself - not counting the borders
        y - The y location of the text area itself - not counting the borders
        width - The width of the field. 100 is the default.
        height - The height of the field. 22 is the default.
        hintText - Text to show in the field as an input hint. May be null for none.

      • TextField

        public TextField(int x,
                 int y,
                 int width,
                 int height,
                 java.lang.String hintText,
                 int firstSpriteID,
                 int bgSpriteID)
        Creates a default text field with the a good amount of constructor customization. What is not available here is available through setter methods. The hint text will be gray, the input text will be black.
        Parameters:
        x - The x location of the text area itself - not counting the borders
        y - The y location of the text area itself - not counting the borders
        width - The width of the field. 100 is the default.
        height - The height of the field. 22 is the default.
        hintText - Text to show in the field as an input hint. May be null for none.
        firstSpriteID - The ID of the first sprite in the set of text field sprites
        bgSpriteID - The ID of the background, from the BACKGROUND set

    • Method Detail

      • commonInit

        private void commonInit()
        Common initialization. Takes care of a lot of things, to avoid repeating them in constructors.

      • defaultSpriteInit

        private void defaultSpriteInit()
        Initialize the text field sprites to the default set (ID 1 - 5)

      • reInitSprites

      • drawElement

        public void drawElement(java.awt.Graphics g,
                        int offsetX,
                        int offsetY)
                 throws IteratorException
        Description copied from interface: Element
        Draw this element to the provided graphics object. The drawing is done using the provided offsets, to account for the container hierarchy. Drawing coordinates should add the offset coordinates with the element's coordinates to obtain the location for this element to draw at.
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics object to draw to
        offsetX - How far off on the X axis this element is from the Graphic's origin
        offsetY - How far off on the Y axis this element is from the Graphic's origin
        Throws:
        IteratorException - If there was an issue iterating child elements

      • clicked

        public void clicked(Element clicked,
                    java.awt.Point relPoint,
                    boolean isRightClick)
        Description copied from interface: Element
        Register that this element has focus, both with the local variable and the controlling class. Aside from that, no special action is taken. If a subclass does override this method, it should certainly call super.elementClicked(...) or perform the focus 'attenuation' itself.
        Specified by:
        clicked in interface Element
        Overrides:
        clicked in class AbstractElement
        Parameters:
        clicked - The element that was clicked. It may not be this element!
        relPoint - The point of click, relative to this element
        isRightClick - True if the right mouse button was clicked

      • keyTyped

        public void keyTyped(char key)
        Description copied from interface: Element
        Does two things. First, will check to see if the event is telling us that we should change focus over to the next thing in line. This behavior can be stopped by intercepting the CHANGE_FOCUS_NEXT event.
        Otherwise, the event will be passed to the parent Element, if there is a parent. If a subclass overrides this for interest in some keys but not all, it should certainly call super.keyTyped(key) to allow the other keys to propagate. (Chain of responsibility)
        Specified by:
        keyTyped in interface Element
        Specified by:
        keyTyped in interface Focusable
        Overrides:
        keyTyped in class AbstractElement
        Parameters:
        key - The character which was typed

      • focusGained

        public void focusGained()
        Calls super.focusGained(). Also creates and starts a task to make the cursor blink.
        Specified by:
        focusGained in interface Element
        Specified by:
        focusGained in interface Focusable
        Overrides:
        focusGained in class AbstractElement

      • focusLost

        public void focusLost()
        Calls super.focusLost(). Also cancels the task to make the cursor blink.
        Specified by:
        focusLost in interface Element
        Specified by:
        focusLost in interface Focusable
        Overrides:
        focusLost in class AbstractElement

      • updateGlyphVector

        private void updateGlyphVector(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d)
        Check to see if the glyph vector is invalid, and if so, update it. The display text is updated as well so that the most current text is shown
        Parameters:
        g2d - Graphics object currently being used to draw with

      • setWidth

        public void setWidth(int width)
        Set the width of the field. This will cause resizing of the sprites and invalidation of the display. Suggested to set this at construction time and not change it.
        Specified by:
        setWidth in interface Element
        Overrides:
        setWidth in class AbstractElement
        Parameters:
        width - The new width of the text area itself

      • setHeight

        public void setHeight(int height)
        Set the height of the field. This will cause resizing of sprites. Suggested to set this at construction time and not change it.
        Specified by:
        setHeight in interface Element
        Overrides:
        setHeight in class AbstractElement
        Parameters:
        height - The new height of the text area itself

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText()
        Returns:
        All of the text in the field

      • setText

        public void setText(java.lang.String text)
        Assign new text to the field. Resets the display and cursor position.
        Parameters:
        text - The new text that will be in the field

      • clearText

        public void clearText()
        Remove all text from the field. A shortcut to setText("");

      • getFont

        Returns:
        The font being used to draw the text

        Parameters:

      • getTextColor

        Parameters:

      • getHintTextColor

        Returns:
        The current color of the hint text

      • setHintTextColor

        public void setHintTextColor(java.awt.Color hintTextColor)
        Parameters:
        hintTextColor - The new color for the hint text

      • setActionHandler

        public void setActionHandler(java.util.function.BiConsumer<TextField,java.lang.String> action)
        Assign an action handler to this TextField. It will be called whenever 'action' is taken on the text field (such as pressing enter.) This will overwrite an existing handler, and may be null to remove an existing handler.
        Parameters:
        action - The method to call when action is taken on the field

      • setSpriteGroup

        public void setSpriteGroup(int firstId,
                           int bgId)
        Sets all of the text field sprites to the given grouping. In the sprites resources, the text field sprites are stored in their own folder. Sprite 0 is the cursor. After that, the sprites will repeat background, top, right, bottom, left border. The provided ID should correspond to the background image.
        Parameters:
        firstId - The ID of the background image in the text field set
        bgId - The ID of the background, from the BACKGROUND set

      • setBgSprite

        public void setBgSprite(int id)
        Set the background image used for the text field. It is scaled to the correct size. Note that the ID is from the BACKGROUND set
        Parameters:
        id - The sprite ID of the background, in the text field set

      • setTopSprite

        public void setTopSprite(int id)
        Set the top border image used around the text field. Scaled to the correct size.
        Parameters:
        id - The sprite ID of the top border, in the text field set

      • setBottomSprite

        public void setBottomSprite(int id)
        Set the bottom border image used around the text field. Scaled to the correct size.
        Parameters:
        id - The sprite ID of the bottom border, in the text field set

      • setRightSprite

        public void setRightSprite(int id)
        Set the right side border image used around the text field. Scaled to the correct size. The scaling depends on the top and bottom borders, so they should be set before the sides if setting both.
        Parameters:
        id - The sprite ID of the right side border, in the text field set

      • setLeftSprite

        public void setLeftSprite(int id)
        Set the left side border image used around the text field. Scaled to the correct size. The scaling depends on the top and bottom borders, so they should be set before the sides if setting both.
        Parameters:
        id - The sprite ID of the left side border, in the text field set

      • showingHint

        public boolean showingHint()
        Check to see if the field is currently showing hint text
        Returns:
        True if the hint text is up

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns:
        True if no text has been placed in the field yet

      • moveCursorForClick

        private void moveCursorForClick(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d)
        Move the cursor so it reflects the location of a click request. Should only be called when their is a click coordinate and the glyph vector is valid
        Parameters:
        g2d - The graphics that drawing is happening on

      • addChar

        private void addChar(char c)
        Add the character to the field, at the current cursor position. May update the displayed text and invalidates the glyph vector
        Parameters:
        c - The character to add

      • backspace

        private void backspace()
        Removes a single character from the field. It is removed from behind the cursor. May update the displayed text and invalidates the glyph vector

      • delete

        private void delete()
        Removes a single character from the field. It is removed from in front of the cursor. May update the displayed text and invalidates the glyph vector

      • clearBeforeCursor

        private void clearBeforeCursor()
        Removes all of the text before the cursor. Due to the bulk nature of this, the display will be totally reset and allowed to determine what to show from the start again.

      • tryCursorLeft

        private void tryCursorLeft()
        Try to move the cursor left if possible. Then, if necessary, the display is modified so that the cursor remains in view.

      • tryCursorRight

        private void tryCursorRight()
        Try to move the cursor right if possible. Then, if necessary, the display is modified so that the cursor remains in view.
